## {data-background-image="images/bg-quote.png"}
>  What does it mean to retreat from knowledge to information? Knowledge is about ideas, about putting ideas together into integrated systems of thought we call disciplines. Information is about facts, about separating out a particular feature of a situation and recording it as an autonomous observation. (Taylor 1990^[Taylor PJ. 1990. Editorial comment GKS. _Political Geography Quarterly_ **9**(3) 211&ndash;212. See also: Goodchild MF. 1991. Just the facts. _Political Geography Quarterly_ **10**(4) 335&ndash;337.], page 212)

# Why 'spatial'? {.smaller}

## Another proposition {data-background-image="images/bg-lightbulb-2.jpg"}
### **geography** &#8800; **geometry**

## The geo-atom {data-background-image="images/bg-quote.png"}
> the fundamental element of geo&shy;graph&shy;ical information is the tuple
$$  
T=\langle x,y,z_1,z_2\ldots z_n\rangle
$$

::: aside
Goodchild in Frank AU and MF Goodchild 1990. Two perspect&shy;ives on geographical data modelling. _NCGIA Technical Reports (9011)_. Available at [escholarship.org](https://escholarship.org/uc/item/7zn585sw).
:::

## {data-background-image="images/bg-quote.png"}
### Here's Alfred North Whitehead: {style="text-align:left;"} 
> [a]s soon as you have settled [...] what you mean by a definite place in space-time, you can adequately state the relation of a particular material body to space-time by saying that it is just there, in that place; and, so far as simple location is concerned, there is nothing more to be said on the subject (Whitehead [1925] 1967^[Whitehead AN. [1925] 1967. _Science and the Modern World: Lowell Lectures, 1925_. The Free Press.], page 50)
